text: Yes, you will.
What the hell are these?
Come on!
I know that, Boyle.
Yeah. 1,000 push-ups.
I don't think we're that dramatic.
Right.
Well...
That's great.
No.
Ha, ha, I guess so, yeah. Why?
Voila!
Oh?
Can't wait to see it.
Yeah!
What’s up with the chair?
Yeah.
Yeah, totally. That makes sense. That makes sense.
Move.
I was. I'm done.
You're welcome.
There is nothing here.
What are you talking about?
Worse.
What's going on?
What's up with this emergency meeting?
What?
Yeah, I know how to spell cone.
Nope.
Nope.
Scully.
Nice.
Yeah!
Coolio. He heads off.
Oh, boy.
Come on!
What's up?
What's happening?
You know I do.
Wow.
Worse.
Boyle says, "Come on, guys." That's two for Terry.
Yes.
I'll pay for that.
Nah, I think I'm good.
Good. You shouldn't know it.
I didn't ask what you were doing. I asked what you are doing.
You asked us to come in here.
Please do.
"I marked them 'Awk' for 'Awkward'?"
What are you wearing?
No way.
I know!
Good.
Yeah.
Come on, guys.
So, Boyle…
Gina!
Yeah.
You’re the only one who did that.
Yeah, I just said that. Chill, man.
I have an idea...
Nice. (Holding coffee)
What? What's going on?
Yeah.
Uh-huh. My turn?
You guys having fun?
Smart. Good call.
He seems like he would.
Sir? Thank you.
I'm backing it up.
What's this?
Wait... Hitchcock?
What is happening?
Really?
What do you need?
No, sir.
Whoa, Detective Santiago.
No.
Does it really say that?
What is all this?
He seems cool.
I don't hear anything.
Oh, I'm gonna find out anyway.
Why? What'd you do?
Um, Hitchcock.
Yay.
What? I put it up there for safe keeping.
What?
So pretty much the same as what I said.
All right, let's get this over with.
Gotcha! Raincheck.
Here she is.
Pass.
Just to be safe? What does that mean?
Yeah.
I know.
Icarus.
Why do you care so much about some old reporter?
Ah...
Sure, that sounds great.
Already done, sir.
Yeah, nice!
Got it.
Okay, all right, thank you, thank you.
Yes.
Whoo!
Rosa. Yes?
Thank you.
1,000 push-ups, really?
Right there.
Yup.
On it!
You did this program?
Great idea.
What's going on?
What's that noise?
Yeah. What's your second point?
And go!
Sure.
Great.
Thank you.
I know how to blink.
What is going on?
Thanks!
Nope.
Oh.
You're here late.
Nice job. What's the plan?
Oh, hell yeah.
Okay. I'm in.
Why are we meeting in the ladies' room?
Mm-hmm.
Yep.
No.
Yes.
Yeah, he seems cool. I agree.
Morning.
Great.
What about your car?
Where was it?
Okay. That sounds... fun.
Yes, sir.
Nope, not doing that again. Move.
Nothing.
No, you are not, Jake Rabbit.
Your what friend now?
You think?
Gotcha. Raincheck on that convo.
Where's he taking you?
No. Where is it?
Could be a year. Could be a decade. Sorry, we're just saying bigger and bigger numbers.
You okay?
Hey. What's going on?
So what you're saying is that this is kind of a...
You know I will.
Yes!
Is that a nightgown?
No.
Still too much.
All right, you got it?
Thank you, Boyle. I appreciate it.
But we'd love to hear it again.
You said 2,000, remember?
Lady bin?
'Sup?
Night, Peralta.
I changed my mind.
Absolutely, sir. Where do we start?
Who else is going?
Backing up, guys.
Choo. Yes.
No, you can't.
What is he doing?
No problem.
I know, it’s crazy.
Why are you smiling? That's nothin’.
Well, we shall see what we shall see.
Okay, okay.
- Charles! -
Good.
Well, this got upsetting real quick.
Really? 'Cause when you left, you made a pretty big deal of deleting us from your phone.
Oh, that's brutal.
It's a pact we made. It really just means "trust me." And I do.
This is incredible.
Oh, that's not good.
Oh. It's happening?
No, Jakey, no! That car is your superpower. Thor would never wager his hammer. Neil Patrick Harris would never wager his showmanship. Losing that car will be the worst thing in the world for you.
Ugh. You made us run up ten flights of stairs.
Oh, my butt!
Here. I feel bad that you spent all that money on the movie tickets.
I don't care about the push-ups, Jake. I care that you didn't honor our pact. I've always trusted you, and when you did that it made me feel like you don't trust me.
Okay, I guess. I mean, if you don't mind.
I hope you understand how serious this is to me.
What? That's not how this works. I said 1,000 push-ups, you have to back me up. That's the pact, end of story.
Wow, is this all for me?

His orders were stupid. I hated him more than any cop I've ever known. Whoa. I just realized I'm never gonna be able to say that to his face. I mean, I could say it to his wife at the funeral, but it won't be the same.
Enough! I'm going to the dumb party but only because I don't want to hurt Marcus. I'm still super mad at you.
How's this? Oh, my God. It's so much worse than I imagined.
Ever since, I kinda got scared of getting hurt. Lost my edge. There was an incident in a department store.
Thank you. But never call me "Ro-ro" again.
That’s right! Boom! I just kicked Santa in the testicles! ....Merry Christmas!
That was perfect.
So, you pretty much got the disaster night you were hoping for?
There. Now you’re hurt in this chair. You can get hurt anywhere, Boyle. And if you do, it won’t be because some shoe salesman predicted it. You make your own destiny.
Damn it.
I'm a textbook people-pleaser. I have a serious problem. This was great though. You must be so proud.
That's a victory. That's a victory for Boyle. Boom!
Thanks. You know, I kind of just realized--
I’m fine. I'm fine.
What's wrong with the way I dress?
That's never happened before. I don't like it.
I was born ready. And then I was not born ready for a while, but now I'm back to being born ready.
Oh, my god.
I don’t know, man. I’m lost. The universe is a cruel and vexing puzzle. I-I’m at the whim of the cosmos.
Um, Carlene predicted if I get out of this chair, I’d get badly hurt, so I’m not chancing it. Oh, man. There’s no more pudding cups left. Ah! What’d you do that for?
Now is not the time, Boyle.
Oh, damn. She called me Terrance. I'm doomed.
Nooo!
Damn it! This is Jeffrey Dahmer's corduroys all over again.
You don't want to do this, man.
That's cold, sir.
Ah, come on!
I think I’m ready. I’m no longer fixating on my fears.
Make it five.
Huh. Boyle's advice worked.
No, I'm still furious at you.
You people already know too much about me.
I would never steal his thunder. I-I'd be afraid to borrow it.
And I'm still not right.
Oh... Yeah.
Yeah, I feel sexy.
It hurts you every time.
So you were lying? What the hell, Boyle?
So sorry, sir. That's terrible.
Come on, guys. I know you're sad, but let's do our best to make a good first impression here.
To be perfectly candid... I like that.
What in the world?
I look like arsenio.
Why? I'm fine on the stand.
That's not helping!
Sir, I'm begging you, please, we have to stop. Boyle is still smoldering.
You lied to me!
I don't know, I didn't wanna mess up. Because you're sort of... Opinionated.
Okay. Well, this is awkward.
Dream team.
Of course I'm nervous! What did you think was the problem?
Damn, it is amazing.
She also made this really depressing prediction about my life.
Yeah, I get it. It's been a rough year. But I've learned to embrace my fears. It makes me a better cop.
Why didn't you just say something to me?
Worried about what?
Good lord. Where did he get that?
Oh, my God, enough.
You have a problem with me that you want to talk about?
Yeah! Winning by default!
So fun.
Shut it! Holt was right. I've been so worried about my own kids, I forgot about my stupid grown-up kids.
It's just the target looks exactly like a friend of mine. It's just freaking me out.
I just need a second.
I can't believe you tricked me!
Don't shush me. I'm helping you.
That's the spirit!
Sir, I may not be the man for the job.
Sir, I haven't fired a weapon since the incident.
Sorry you got vultured. Happens to the best of us.
You mean drive you there and wait outside... Far away from the guns.
So it's... perfect?
No! I can do this. It's just driving me a little crazy. Where do I affix the princess tower, Boyle?! Where do I affix it?!
This is not good. The lawyer is that slimeball grundhaven... Rosa hates him!
Yes. You have to pull it together.
That's what sarge says to me when I'm nervous. Rosa, I think you're nervous.
But if the problem is that you're nervous, that's where Charles Boyle lives, baby. I can help! You just need to go to your happy place.
She went to her happy place.
Yes, I did, and I am thrilled with the results. Although the jar is really hot.
Oh, I love being Scary Terry. He says what regular Terry's thinking.
Not now, Boyle. Let a brother breathe. Let a brother breathe.
I cannot figure you out.
It's gonna be a long road, but I'm ready to get myself back in the game.
Way to go, Jakey.
I'm always the victim. I don't want to be the victim.
No. I'll be the victim. Don't make me a door again.
Wow!
Thank you, sir. I'll never forget it.

It's whack, and you know it. Their number-one crime is tricycle theft. There's a bakery attached to the precinct. Come on, Santiago. You never would've taken that job, so why'd you even care that they offered it to me?
This is such a disaster.
What? (laughs nervously) That is not true, okay? I-I-I don't even like food.
He makes me feel so small.
I'm sorry I couldn't convince you to love Halloween.
Well, you're not the only girl at the table anymore. We work in a police force full of dudes. We gotta have each other's backs, okay?
Yeah, I got your back. Don't smile. I'm still mad at you.
Ha! "Boyle objects to Boyle Bingo."
You paid money to get out of working with me?
Damn!
Look, Jake, I love you like you're one of my daughters.
'Stume! Oh, my God. It caught on.
I can do it.
Yeah, till you made the best Thanksgiving meal I've ever had and ruined it.
Great! Now I'm starving!
Boyle, you're always blogging on that foodie website. Which pie's better?
I owe you one, Boyle. Thank-you dinner. Tomorrow night. Gribaldi's. It's all-you-can-eat linguini.
Hey, Gina, can you order food for us at the Flatbush Diner? They make the best pies in New York City.
Pie taste test, it's over. I won.
I think it was flan.
It's all right. 6 out of 12.
Is it in your pockets?
Where is it?
I love yogurt.
Everything's spoiled. My lunch is ruined. My chicken, my potatoes, my pasta, my meatballs, ham, my yogurt. (Takes out every meal)
Damn it, Boyle. You left the fridge open. The door couldn't shut because of your empty pizza box.(Takes out the pizza box)
Actually, I don't like pickles that much.
The department never washes them, so it's probably vomit. Hey! I got you a chocolate. Yet another great thing about Halloween... chocolate!
Bring out the meringues.
I'm gonna shake it out of your pockets. Turn around.
Another one for Crust. It's not looking good for Flatbush Diner.
Kitchen buds.
For the 12 components of food satisfaction: Salty, sweet, sour, bitter, umami, odor, sound...
Oh, wow. That's the best pie I ever had.
(sighs) I'm sorry about the whole pie blowup thing. You're right. The Flatbush Diner pie is awful.
Hey, Rosa, the Flatbush Diner's pie is terrible. It's inedible. Food is supposed to be edible.

Crust isn't any better. It's fancier, but it's all bells and whistles. Desserts don't need to be clever. They just need to be good. This is the best pie in New York City... Apple from Argos Bakery, founded 1910. Recipe unchanged. Taste it.
You just graduated pie school, bitches. Sorry I said "bitches," I'm just really worked up.

I'm sorry, Jake, Sal's is only the eighth-best. I put out a weekly Brooklyn pizza-ranking email blast. Sal's has the fourth-best texture, ninth-best crust, twelfth-best cheese, and honestly, they're only seventh in mouth-feel.

That's unacceptable. If you wanna know which restaurant has better pies, you can't just have one guy try one pie from each place. Everybody needs to try all the pies from both places. We gonna be here awhile.
Mario is number ten overall in Brooklyn, and rising fast. He might've wanted to move up the ladder.
Release your sweets.
Why wouldn't you? They're both white powders. Of course they're interchangeable.
Oh, man! My muffin. Ahh! Oh, my head! My muffin, my head! And I stepped on the... On my muffin! And my head and my muffin.
Jamon lberico is an amazing cured ham from Spain. They had it at my uncle's funeral. I gorged myself at that funeral. I mean, I was constipated for three days.
Look, she still has the bags of baby carrots I requested they put in. They're black now, but they're there.
Jamon lberico.
Beneficio's might.
Oh! I'm Henry Morgenthau, owner of delicious and expensive hams. Don't I know you from the grocery store?
That's a waste of manchego!
I left one for you.
No waiting, just toasting. I want you to toast. Now I wanna eat toast. Give me some toast!
Absolutely. Hey, Boyle. You want to choose where we order lunch from today?
There's a lot of food up there?
You could eat off his shirt.
Don't worry, guys, I found food. (Sets a box down and eat the packing peanuts)
But the cook is coming back.
Do you have any more of these pretzels?
I ate one string bean. It tasted like fish vomit. That was it for me.
Toilet.
Can't. I'm so stuffed.
Ah... Hey, Charles, just take my coffee. It's fresh.
It'll be the perfect opportunity to update my rankings. Can we stop at home for a pizza bib?
I'll just use my work bib.
Gino... This pizza is much better than last time. You've always ranked dead last in structural integrity and sauce.
Peanut butter will not be joining us.
I knew just where to punch it to get free food. Now I have to go back to punching Hitchcock.
All right! I've been craving Sudanese all day. I'll print out some menus.
Really? You're lifting the lifetime ban? I thought my lunch choices were "horrifying adventures in diarrhea."
Cold milk.
Yeah, I know. Check out these doughnuts. Whoo-hoo!
In a word, yes. Amateurs go tasting, they fill up, and they lose their palate by the third slice. I take this very seriously.
You eat with your eyes, so the plating alone...
It's a real culinary challenge. Give me 15 minutes, and then we feast.
Tommy, can we order some food?
So this is your lunch for, like, the month?

So this is kind of a play on your typical Thanksgiving dinner. For turkey, we have the Peking duck with a veggie samosa stuffing. The potatoes are the empanadas with an Ethiopian lentil stew gravy. And for dessert, some seasonal gelatin cups. Okay, I ran out of money. They're from when Hitchcock got his colonoscopy. Bon appétit. (Takes a seat)
Happy Turkey Day.
The crust was charred, the cheese was stringy and flavorless, but the sauce. Oh, Marone, the sauce. Continue.
Pizza? Please. This is a butternut squash and truffle butter flatbread.
Wow, that's a lot of yogurt.
I'm in a cabin in the middle of nowhere. Inside it's just me and that stupid, slimy defense attorney.
Don't make me hit you again.
Stop saying "insatiable."
Why are you so obsessed with that game?
I'm just gonna put you down, man.
You get that hand near me again, you're gonna lose it.
Anyone over the age of six celebrating a birthday should go to hell.
Ugh. What do you even know about this person?
Oh, now I'm gonna hit you for real.
No. But it does say, "Boyle believes obvious lie."
What's that? Sounds stupid.
You think I have an anger problem? I don't. You are both dead to me.
Sir, are you familiar with the story of Icarus? He didn't know when to quit. He flew too close to the sun, and his wax wings melted, and he died.
Extinguisher's empty, morons.
Really? A tad, icarus?
It's my birthday. I hate birthdays. If you wish me a Happy Birthday, I will punch you.
Great advice, dummies. I look like a psycho up there!
His pain meds are making him weird.
You're not very bright, are you, Bill?
This is creepy and unlike you. You even know her first name?
Can't you just buy another knockoff?
"Look up who Picasso is."
Don't lie to me, Boyle, or you will be eating your bone marrow custard through a straw.
You're a weird guy, Jake.
Don't quote Die Hard.
If you knew me, you'd know I hate surprise parties, so clearly you don't know me at all.
Oh, look at that. "Boyle saves Thanksgiving."
Try me.
It's so pleasant and boring. But, Holt, at your house, surrounded by these idiots? Guaranteed train wreck. Thanks for the invite. (Smiles)
Fine. One false move, and I tase you in front of your mom.
You probably read a Maya Angelou poem at your graduation and cried.
It looks like you live on the set of Murder, She Wrote.
A P.I.? These guys are hacks.
Moment's over. Shut up.
'Cause I'm not. His mom put this stupid braid in my hair.
Are you eating packing peanuts?
No, you look like a Boyz II Men Easter album.
Mm. Sick burn.
Fine, what about this guy?
That's it. Get in my car, now. And if you say another word, I promise you, you will regret it.

Savant, you're part of the nine-nine now. We look after each other. Hey, ball, if savant was to do anything to harm this precinct, would I destroy him? (Terry crushes the 8 ball with his hand, Charles eyes are widen) Answer uncertain. Try again.
Do I? One of you is a criminal, and the other one is dressed like Steve Harvey. It's over. I'm ending this now. Sorry, Jake.
I'd love to see you date someone from work. Your head would explode.
Why stop there? Why not tell her you're an astronaut?
Sarge, I don't need to be monitored all day long. I'm not a toddler. This is stupid.
Dude, stop saying random facts to try to prove you know me.
That will never happen. In fact, you just lost "Rosa" privileges. From now on, you can call me "Diaz" or "Hey, you."
You're not a genie.
Why are you still playing with that stupid game, Sarge? The guy is dead.
I should've been on you guys more. And starting now, I will be. But if you ever do this again, I swear I will crush your head in one hand.
What's the matter with you?
He quit to start a carpet cleaning business, because that was better than being Captain here because this is the most boring place on earth.
Fine. How do I get these morons to like me?
What if you called him from a hospital and said his whole family is dead? Like, they died of cancer.
Hitchcock farts nonstop.
(scoffs) Wouldn't you like to know?
Who's Rosa? Y-you're the scared one.
Your wife and Boyle's mom are both blind?
Now I gotta read something?
Snitches. What about it?
Losers.
That thing where we try to get a bunch of loser kids to become student snitches?
Don’t arrest him. Just smack him. Hard. With a phone book on a body part no one can see, you know what I’m saying?
You know what they don't teach you at the academy? It's better to be a criminal.
Here's a hint. I'm not gonna tell you.
Thank you, Carlene. Your entire life is garbage.
Also not interesting.
How's that interesting?
Babysitting. Ha-ha!
It's not awkward. I like your company. You're sweet.
You think I'm opinionated? Okay, here's an opinion for you. You're a bad judge of character and your shirt looks like vomit.
Citizen Kane is terrible. Pick a good movie.
Tell me who has me for Secret Santa.
Maybe it was just old person gunk. You know how old people always have that gunk on them.
Get off him, Boone! You big marshmallow!
Wouldn't you like to know?
Hit him in his fat, cherry cheeks!
Ugh. Really, Gina? A psychic?
If you wanted to make a bet with Holt, you shoulda made a bet you could win. Like who wears more denim jackets.
At least you get to sit on your butt all day.
And when this is over, I'm gonna find you, and I'm gonna break those little fingers.
Hey, is this why you were getting makeup tips from the prostitute in the holding cell?
No. And no one has ever thought that.
Wrong. Ignorant and wrong.
Fine. I'll take your dumbass seminar.
You tell anyone, I break your face. {ROSA CLOSES HER DRAWER WITH HER FOOT}
I'm sorry... can you make her stop doing that weird thing with her face?
Gina, we've been looking all over for you. You can't just disappear and leave a sign on your desk that says, "gone leavin'."
No one asked you to take your shirt off. Stop volunteering to take your shirt off.
We're helping Jake's friend get out of his slump.
I’ve talked a lot about Jake in my departmentally mandated therapy sessions.
I'm sorry, sir, but that's impossible. With the twins learning how to walk, chaos reigns at the Jeffords household. I can't let those innocent pups into that madhouse. Terry won't do you like that.
Fine. Let's talk about the cat. Short-hair, long-hair? Tabby?
Well, I haven't really been in a slump since my divorce. So I'd tell this person, "Maybe get divorced." He'd have to get married first.
...I popped your pillow.
A year ago, my wife and I had twin baby girls. Cagney and Lacey.
I'm- I'm not really her husband.
That's mine. It's a t-shirt from my fat phase.
I had the same exact one when I was a kid!
He can clearly spot 'em. You should take my minivan.
You all got a problem with my minivan?
‘Cause my wife doesn't like it either. She wanted an SUV, but those things roll, man. They roll!
You made a mixtape?
You want some help, big man?
We just assumed you were a terrifying human being with a short fuse.
Did he let you play your mixtape?
I love the bus!
Get an iPod, man. Mixtape?
On the side of the turret-
Broad shoulders! Stuck! Told you... Broad shoulders.
Fatter, sir. They called me "Terry tіttіеs." Because I had large, uh...

I like it. Hey, guys? Guys, I really need your help. My little boy, Brian, my angel, I bought him a short-haired calico after my wife fell into a coma... Motorcycle crash. And now the cat's stuck in a tree.
I was in the bathroom with him, sir. It was a nightmare.
What? There's a penis on my minivan?
Whattaya say we grab a drink?
Let's talk strategy later tonight at my house. My wife's working late, I'm on daddy duty.
How old is Kelly again?
Hey, my flight is at eight tonight. It’s domestic. Do you think I’ll be safe if I get to the airport five hours early?
I've gone 42 years without a lump of coal I’m not gonna start now.
Fine, but I am gonna play the hell out of some backgammon. Watch me.
No, this will not be our Thanksgiving. All right, you all wait here. Give me an hour. Terry, to the door.
Sarge, am I too heavy?
I-I'm not done hanging out. Let's go to the bar, they serve food there. That's a great idea.
My wife takes the babies to the park all the time.
Yeah. I had it on my desk, but I kept spilling coffee on it. Oops.
I'm sorry, honey. I just didn't want you to worry.
No! I have broad shoulders. I have narrow hips, but broad shoulders. God!
Well, guess what. I can spoil your little game by sitting over here quietly all day and doing nothing. (Takes a seat and falls on floor) Oh! Aah!
No, no, she punched me to prove Carlene wrong.

I thought I told you. Remember when you were half asleep watching the news and the babies were quiet, and I said, real low, "hey, baby. I'm back in the field. You want something to eat?" And you were like, "what?" And I was like, "you want something to eat?" And you said, "sure." And I got you an oatmeal cookie? Remember?
I like Turner & Hooch. Tom Hanks, reluctant friendship with a dog. That hits me where I live.
Hey, baby. Happy you made it. Captain, I'd like you to meet my wife, Sharon.
He stared at me for 90 seconds while he ate an entire peach.
Captain reads my blast.
A little lower.
Okay, okay, okay. Then it is settled. If Peralta loses, Santiago gets his car. If Santiago loses, she goes for a date in said car.
Brian was adopted, so he has abandonment issues. Just struck out at tee-ball last week. Everyone called him "cryin' Brian."
He's a cute kid. Kinda looks like you. Handsome guy. Handsome little guy.
Seriously? The bet? They've been keeping score all year. It comes up all the time. What are you doing all day?
But on the plus side, I think I know what to do with them.
Well, now that I know you want me to say that, I'll just say it with two gobbles. Gobble, gobble... Gobble. God, it just sounds right that way. Ugh. I don't like this game.
Hey, I'm not gonna be able to make dinner tonight.
Baby, I've got some bad news. Someone painted a giant penis on our minivan. No, you cannot have an SUV now. Those things roll, baby. They roll!
When you're that big, you buy anything that fits. A lot of fat guy clothes have racist overtones.
Jake, it's been in my mouth.
Uh, why do you wanna borrow the toothbrush?
Yes. Let's all just count to a million. One, two, three, four, five, six... So then lceman says, "You can be my wingman any day." And then Maverick says...
I'm just glad I keep a toothbrush here.
I used a gift card for that!
Maybe he doesn't have any. Interesting fact about me... I once burnt my fingerprints off on a wok.
Fine, what was with the flossing?
How long were we asleep?
I mean, eventually... Not tonight. I need to go hug my baby girls. Excuse me.
I didn't know you went to catholic schooL
I get it. You're so mysterious and tough. But you know what I think? You're actually a big softy.
You're the best, Jake.
I need to eat 10,000 calories a day to maintain muscle mass. My wife made me all of this before she left town with the kids. That was everything in my fridge. (Closes fridge door)
Oh, uh, you know, I-I haven't been to either place yet.
Come on, Amy! Loosen up! You look like such a cop! Come on, have some fun, you know? It'll help you blend in! Whoo!
What provided our success.
I still want to know why you got kicked out of catholic school. Were you doing drugs?
Selling drugs?
How bad could it have been? Did you burn down a church?
Well, guess what she said. Apparently, you were a model student and transferred of your own volition.
I'm fine. And I filled this out. I just need you to... Permission to yawn, sir.

No, all the things that you think are bad about Halloween are what make it great. The big kids egg you. Then you and your friends run away together. Friendships are forged in the crucible of Halloween adversity. That's all I wanted for us. You can keep the wig. I don't need it anymore.
I knew it! I knew you were a big softy.
I'm not tired. Why would you think I was tired?
I ended up doing 25 minutes of sleep chin-ups on muscle memory alone. Tired Terry still gets after it, that's all I'm saying.
Just long enough for me to squeeze in quick workout. So, like, three hours.
Jake, you're the best.
So great. We're having the best time. Right, Amy?
